title: QO+R Framework: From String Theory to Galactic Observations
description:
Complete theoretical framework and empirical validation of the QO+R (Quotient Ontologique + Reliquat) modified gravity model. This repository contains three interconnected research papers:

- Paper 1: Environmental Modulation of the BTFR - Discovery of U-shaped residual pattern
- Paper 2: Residual Diagnostic Methodology - Extension to biomarkers (NHANES)
- Paper 3: From String Theory to Galaxies - Complete derivation and validation on 708,086 galaxies

Key findings include the confirmation of the 'killer prediction' (sign inversion for R-dominated systems at 6.3σ significance) and the natural emergence of λ_QR ≈ 1 from Calabi-Yau geometry.
references: Lelli, F., McGaugh, S.S., & Schombert, J.M. (2016). SPARC: Mass Models for 175 Disk Galaxies. AJ, 152, 157
Pillepich, A., et al. (2018). First results from the IllustrisTNG simulations. MNRAS, 475, 648
Kachru, S., Kallosh, R., Linde, A., & Trivedi, S.P. (2003). De Sitter vacua in string theory. PRD, 68, 046005
Haynes, M.P., et al. (2018). The Arecibo Legacy Fast ALFA Survey. ApJ, 861, 49
notes: This work presents a hypothesis connecting string theory phenomenology to astrophysical observations. The connection remains tentative and requires further investigation.
